I really used to enjoy this app, but can no longer access any games except one. App will not exit full screen.
summary: Cannot access any of the games except one since Ubuntu update

description: If you are into solitaire card games AisleRiot is going to impress you for sure, AisleRiot is one of the finest examples of GNOME games.

I've used this game for years with MATE, Cinnamon and XFCE as well as GNOME. It runs just as well across all three and provides a great selection of games. The cards are rendered attractively and clearly, they scale well to the size of the window or screen too.
summary: Best solitaire package for GTK desktops

description: Iha ok :D 5/5 pelaisin uudestaa

Offers a good selection of different games so you'll always have something new to play.

An auto-complete feature would be nice. Otherwise, a good stable suite of games.
Smooth, classic styling. A wide variety of games. Simple statistics to give you something to play for.
what to write for a boring game.
It may look a little old fashioned but this is an effective implementation of many great classic solitaire card games. Good for wasting time.
I think it's a good game. Although it looks very old. But it's nice
try to play and the card goes dark and cannot be moved, needs an update.
Very nice, it should come by default
summary: Very nice, it should come by default

description: Looks like the real card game.

There are a ton of games, though many are just slightly modified variations. I've played every one and found many to be worth doing. Keeps track of win/loss and how long you played, but there's no 1 big scoreboard. Would be helpful to see overall stats to help keep track of which games you've played and won.
At the end of winning a game, there is no cool animation where the cards go whroooof. Lame! All we get for winning a game is a lame text.

Why is this included in the standard Ubuntu package?
It's a nuisance to uninstall
time pass game alternative to windows game
Good app for playing card sorting games but the classic Klondike/Patience game is not there!

Pros:
There are a ton solitaire games built in. Has a decent hint system.

Cons:
The rule / move detections are spotty across all the games. One game will tell you there aren't any moves. Another will just cycle through the same 2 or 3 moves in a loop.
Freecell has a game breaking bug where a perfectly legal move will not work. Example: A stack from 10-7 can't be moved on to a properly opposite color Jack. It's nearly impossible to complete some games because of this.
summary: It's good but has some issues

description: I love this game except for one minor detail, one that nags at me everytime I open AisleRiot -- the cards are way too big. Due to this, I sometimes can't see my suite on the card. I would still recommend it to anyone.
summary: Good, but cards are too big

description: Great for just casually killing 5 to 10 minutes and then returning to working on something

This is good
good
it is different from windows solitaire but is fun none the less . is good for wasting time
Had fun wasting some time
summary: Fun way to waste some time

description: It's cool to play sometimes.
Excellent time waster

description: Wished the cards bounced around the screen when you completed the game. Instead we just get a very underwhelming dialog box saying 'Congratulations'.
summary: Wished cards bounced around when finished

description: Game is OK with many options but it is so inefficient. For example, you should be able to double-click a card and if there is a spot available for it, it should go there automatically, in order to avoid a time-consuming drag-and-drop. Also, when all the cards are displayed, a "Solve" button should move all the cards at their place, saving minutes of wasted time!
It's a very good application. It has so many variations of solitaire to play. Some are hard, some are easy. I find them fun to play.

The deck is not dealt randomly. Invariably you will be missing one ace and it will usually be fount high up in the last row. If you do get all four aces then you will find a 2 high up in the last two rows. If you play this game with a real deck of cards, you will usually score over 60% of game that you will complete whereas with this game you will have to be very good to score 45%. When you have played with real cards then this variation is very frustrating.
I love the look and the feel of this card game. This helps me keep my mind off the horrors outside. It does it well!
i think it is really good for your brain.
summary: great app learned a lot from it

solitaire ive played maybe 10 straight games and not one game has led to a victory when the stakes are supposed to be a minimum of 50/50 i normally play with a deck of cards and odds are always 50/50 unless you play single draw the game wont let you win with triple draw none the less still a great game but i dont expect to win any time soon at the rate its dealing
Pretty good Solitaire app, I like how many games it has. Though I don't really like how platonic the GNOME developers were when they designed this app.

If you like flipping cards without crashing, this "game" is for you.
If you actually want to play solitare, you'll need a different application.

I love this version.. I have tried a lot of solitaire versions but this is the best.

description: Just like the one i used to play in childhood. Perfectly done.
I have tried many solitaire sites and this is the best one I have ever found. Have used it for several years and still love it! Great job - thanks!

Lots of fun, so many different games to choose from. I especially like Freecell and Spider.

As title! Probably the best version of solitaire out there!
Long time user, Aisle Riot is about as versatile as a real deck of cards and an instruction book.. It's solitaire. You can't improve it.

I've had a good time with this game, it basically does exactly what it set out to do, but the version of Solitaire that shows up in this by default, Klondike, is completely missing from the select game list! I am extremely confused and have spent a lot of time trying and failing to figure this out!
summary: Main game missing from game list??

description: please add 2-3 rounds for the each game.

First thing is first, the "redraw bug" is not a bug. At least here in America, I think we're used to our Solitare games to allow what the game terms "unlimited redraws." To set this, go to Klondike -> Unlimited Redeals

Overall the application looks nice, but they should really update the design to match GNOME design philosphy. There's a ton of different card designs, although personally I think most of them are kinda...ugly. With all that aside, there's no other solitare app out there that packs this many card games in one package.
summary: A Surprisingly Highly Configurable Solitare Game!

description: Freecell is my favorite.
summary: It has practically every card game types

I used to use a DOS VM with Windows 3.1 installed to play solitaire, (for real), but this circumvents this by ignoring the modern BS with the ads, micro-transactions, point systems, daily challenges, and all that nonsense.

It's like playing a game of Solitaire without the corporate bombardment of reminders of how capitalism run rampant corrupts even the most simple of things, because it is! Yay Linux!
I've loved this solitaire package on Fedora for many, many years and still do. Unfortunately, it refuses to launch on Silverblue.

Since upgrading to Gnome 42 it has forced UI back to Adwaita White. Even though my system is set to dark mode, what is this Windows lol. Otherwise has always and will always be a great app. can't wait for dark mode to work again. Gnome Libawaita light theme has always sucked bulls.
summary: Back to over riding Dark mode in Gnome 42, PUKE UI, but great game
